ðŸŒŸ check-if-email-exists | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Verifying the existence and deliverability of email addresses in bulk or individually without the risk of triggering spam filters or sending unwanted emails.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Email existence check without sending emails â€¢ Rust library for programmatic usage â€¢ Dockerized HTTP backend API â€¢ Command-line interface (CLI) tool â€¢ Support for SOCKS5 proxies
ðŸ“– Summary: This Rust repository provides a tool to check if an email address is valid and deliverable without sending an actual email. It offers a programmatic API, a CLI, and a Dockerized HTTP backend for integration into various applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ unity-mcp | C#
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Allowing AI assistants (LLMs) to directly control and automate tasks within the Unity Editor.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Natural Language Control â€¢ Powerful Tools for asset, scene, material, script management â€¢ Automation of repetitive Unity workflows â€¢ Extensible design for various MCP Clients â€¢ HTTP-First Transport with stdio fallback
ðŸ“– Summary: Unity MCP is a server that enables AI assistants, such as Claude and Cursor, to interact directly with the Unity Editor. It acts as a bridge, allowing LLMs to control assets, scenes, scripts, and automate tasks within Unity using the Model Context Protocol.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Constrict | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Compressing video files to meet specific size limitations for uploads or storage, without manual trial-and-error.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intuitive GUI for easy video compression â€¢ Automatic calculation of encoding parameters (ABR, resolution, framerate, audio quality) to meet target file size â€¢ Bulk compression of multiple videos â€¢ Customizable framerate limits
ðŸ“– Summary: Constrict is a desktop application that compresses video files to a user-defined target file size. It automates the complex process of re-encoding videos by intelligently adjusting parameters like bitrate, resolution, and framerate to achieve the desired size while aiming to preserve audiovisual quality.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ richpixelvid | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Playing video files in a terminal with a unique retro-style visualization.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Terminal-based video playback using Unicode half-block characters â€¢ Automatic terminal size detection and video scaling â€¢ Configurable playback frame rate â€¢ Loop playback option â€¢ Memory-efficient streaming
ðŸ“– Summary: Rich-Pixel Video Player is a Python tool that plays video files directly in your terminal using Unicode characters for a retro, pixelated visual style. It leverages the rich-pixels library to render video frames with enhanced vertical resolution.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ refund-swatter-lite | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Preventing fraudulent App Store refunds by automating the response to Apple's consumption request notifications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) for In-App Purchase Keys â€¢ Real-time processing of CONSUMPTION_REQUEST notifications â€¢ 100% Supabase architecture, no additional servers â€¢ Automated workflow â€¢ Calculates all 12 required Apple consumption fields
ðŸ“– Summary: Refund Swatter Lite is a serverless, single-tenant application built on Supabase designed to prevent fraudulent App Store refunds. It processes Apple's CONSUMPTION_REQUEST notifications in real-time, sending back essential consumption data to help Apple make informed refund decisions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ Logics-Parsing | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Accurate and structured parsing of complex documents, especially those containing scientific content like formulas and chemical structures.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Effortless End-to-End Processing â€¢ Advanced Content Recognition (including scientific formulas and SMILES for chemical structures) â€¢ Rich, Structured HTML Output (with category, bounding box, OCR text)
ðŸ“– Summary: Logics-Parsing is an end-to-end document parsing model that uses a Vision-Language Model (VLM) to accurately analyze and structure complex documents, including scientific formulas and chemical structures. It outputs rich, structured HTML with content category, bounding boxes, and OCR text, while filtering out irrelevant elements.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
